title: Complete move to "diagnostic items"

labels.name: C-cleanup
labels.description: Category: PRs that clean code up or issues documenting cleanup.

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
With https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/60966, we can avoid lang items and manual path matching for lints, and instead mark them in the code. But I think there are some places that could still be ported to the new system:

* [ ] The `InvalidValue` lint uses `match_def_path` for `transmute` -- somehow, using a diagnostic item did not work (`is_diagnostic_item` returns false).
* [x] Aren't `Rc` and `Arc` lang items just for diagnostics? Here's where they get used: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/f49f38871389041671cc710a044e8360091840a3/src/librustc_typeck/check/expr.rs#L879-L880
    And, indirectly, at
    https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/f49f38871389041671cc710a044e8360091840a3/src/librustc_mir/borrow_check/error_reporting.rs#L720-L723
    So, I am not sure if those should be lang items or diagnostic items now? No language semantics is attached to them, the uses above are just in error messages from what I can see. 
* [x] There's also no language semantics attached to `MaybeUninit`; it is a lang item because it gets used in layout construction for generators. Doesn't really fit "diagnostics item" either, though. (EDIT: decided this makes more sense to remain a lang item)

@oli-obk @Centril any thoughts?
